ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 5 hours
I spent approximately 5 hours or more per week on this class.
5-10 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Both theory and more practical aspects of ethics were discussed, I enjoyed the small class size, student presentations increased the amount of discussion in the classWeaknesses: Lectures were sometimes all over the place and weren't very organized. Also, I would have appreciated more concrete examples, since sometimes ethical theory took over and the public health side was sort of lost.
Amazing class. The professor has really put together a good class and it shows. He has really focused on ethical themes and has applied them well to public health issues. I was really impressed.

The readings in this course were great! We were exposed to many different facets of public health. I really appreciated learning about the theories behind public health ethics, then being able to apply those theories in practical examples of public health practice. I really appreciated the instruction of Professor Jennings and I think the class addressed the topic in a comprehensive manner. I really enjoyed writing the papers using fiction books and information on ethical theory applications to public health. This was a very enjoyable class.

The class is okay, but we it only scratches the surface of the ethical issues. We spend more time talking about Charles Dickens then we do on the questions raised by public health research.I would get rid of the two book reports and replace at least one with another public health related assignment (maybe have us respond to a particular policy or media report about it to see how its framed).Also we need to have more discussions rather than lectures.

Wish we had focused more on how ethical concepts applied to public health--too much discussion of utilitarianism at the beginning. But otherwise, I enjoyed this class- felt like it gave me a framework with which to approach public health as a field as well as specifically in the course of doing my own research and evaluating the implications of public health measures.
Gives students an idea of what and how ethics are considered in public health. Some bit of philosophy.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Bruce Jennings  Prof. Jennings has great knowledge of ethics, though his lectures sometimes go off on tangents. I think his lectures might be improved by having lecture slides or another more organized system. I also think more class discussion would break up the two-hour lecture format.

Instructor: Bruce Jennings  Professor Jennings is such an impressive man. He is so humble yet knows so much and really has a heart for students. This was a small class but the professor showed what could be done well in a discussion/seminar style of class. This was really one of my most enjoyable classes this semester.
Instructor: Bruce Jennings  great, really knowledgeable.

Instructor: Bruce Jennings  Professor Jennings always made himself available and his instruction in class was phenomenal. He made sure to make topics clear to use and explain thoroughly. In addition, he facilitated discussion very well. He made a great syllabus and I enjoyed being one of his students.

Instructor: Bruce Jennings  Professor Jennings tended to be a lecturer rather than a seminar leader. While he said that he would "open the class up to discussion" after he made his "brief" point, he often took the reminder of the course. I would suggest that he allow more time for discussion.

Instructor: Bruce Jennings  I thought Jennings did a good job with this course- I enjoyed hearing his very intelligent thoughts on various matters and thought he did a pretty good job of stimulating discussion amongst the class.
Instructor: Bruce Jennings  A wonderful instructor. Well-rounded knowledge of ethics in public health. Good teaching style. Readily available and eager to answer questions.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This was a good introductory course in ethics and provided some information on how it is applied in public health.
Take it!The class is a good class for understanding public health from a philosophical perspective. The professor is a great teacher and really makes the class engaging andexciting.

The readings in this course were great! We were exposed to many different facets of public health. I really appreciated learning about the theories behind public health ethics, then being able to apply those theories in practical examples of public health practice. I really appreciated the instruction of Professor Jennings and I think the class addressed the topic in a comprehensive manner. I really enjoyed writing the papers using fiction books and information on ethical theory applications to public health. This was a very enjoyable class.
Good class- thought-provoking and not too much work.
A good introduction to ethical issues in public health. Not so much work. Good learning environment.
